revised_title: Investigating the Resistance of Air on Moving Bodies
tldr: The author, John Wallis, examines the resistance of air on moving objects and develops a mathematical model to calculate the impact of air resistance on the motion of projectiles. He proposes that air resistance is proportional to the speed of the object, and that it diminishes the object's celerity and force. Wallis's findings contribute to the understanding of projectile motion and the role of air resistance in it.
